review_title: Good starter into the clinical setting

cons: Have minimal to no pay structure based on education and experience level. Someone with 10 years of experience only makes 3K more than a new graduate. High turnerover for dietitians and clinical managers.

review_title: If I could give it "0" Stars I would
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in New York, NY
pros: The team I work with is excellent, but sadly there is no Nursing Support from Administration.
cons: The Management does not foster growth or care to support their staff. They don't seem to care about the patients, and many basic tools are lacking, so it is difficult for the nurses to perform their jobs properly. They don't emphasize education and reeducation for nurses and the staff to patient ratio is dangerous. They waste so many resources training new RNs who end up leaving in less then a year, because it is such a poor working environment. Sadly the ones who suffer the most from all of this are the patients and the community.

pros: Staff members are very great to work with, wonderful experience in helping low-income mothers receive proper nutrition and breastfeeding services.
cons: Employers practice tricky ways of modifying  job descriptions prior to hiring; management engages into heavy micro-managing and lack of respect for employees; job environment is very dramatic and stressful; staff members talk negatively behind managers' backs, no room for job position growth, no salary raises; technology and overall environment for work is not up to date; insensible restrictions of using personal devices on the job; no internet access. Higher-up bosses are extremely authoritative and condescending; not open to new and innovative ways to improve the WIC program.  The WIC Program is Government Grant-Based, therefore the job is dependent on aggressively grabbing caseloads from participants; otherwise grant funding will be in jeopardy; which lead to their horrible business practices.

review_title: Not a place for someone under 30.
pros: Great location, tight knit community.
cons:
Union employees who have been at the hospital for 15+ years bring this place down, they are so complacent and management can't do anything about it.  Every single dollar spent out of the budget needs to be run past the director of finance before you can make any purchase--there isn't even petty cash anymore for a purchase that you can't get out of one of the standard companies they purchase from. 

Senior Management have no people skills (or at least the head of the department I work in doesn't).

Current supervisor doesn't communicate with employees or value employee feedback.

job_title: Service Desk Analyst in New York, NY
pros: There is a lot you can learn here. I had the pleasure of working with a great team and decent leadership. Learning and growth was encouraged.
cons:
Management is like a revolving door and there is absolutely no stability. New management comes new ideas and ideals; though this is good, the constant change isn’t. The lack of respect and recognition of tenured employees is offensive. 
The only people who see a pay increase here is management 6 figures and no management skill. Managers come here to rape THBC then leave.

pros: Steady work, safe employment, support a good cause and help thousands of needy people all around the borough
cons: NO UNION. Autocratic management style  very difficult to use sick time without getting in trouble   I have seen dozens of people come and go even die. They all lose their personal and vacation time as well as accumulated sick time.  Human resources is useless with any problem

review_title: My experience was both rewarding and disappointment.
